summary: level ball and dream ball
question: level ball and dream ball
answer:
Level Ball: I’ve had quite a few Level 100s. I think the first one I raised to that level myself was an Absol
Dream Ball: 6 Beedril. In seriousness, A Beedril, Slurpuff, Houndoom, Skitty, Celebi and Mew would be fun!

summary: Porygon
body:
Porygon

Anyone want to help me trade up my Porygon until it reaches Porygon Z in Pokémon Sun and Moon? I thought someone would be nice enough if used GTS but they just keep taking mine and leave me with one they got in a wonder trade. It’s making me so upset. Let me know if you’re up for it. Thanks.

summary:
Gibble type swap
Gibble (Amazonian Form):
An Amazon gibble is a pack hunter and eats everything from Pokémon that accidentally...
body:
Gibble type swap

Gibble (Amazonian Form):

An Amazon gibble is a pack hunter and eats everything from Pokémon that accidentally falls into the river to berries. They have a fearsome reputation and have been reported to be a problem in the upstream of the Amazon. Many trainers have tried to tame this species of gibble but have failed. Only those who are strong-willed and have brute strength is able to train this mini man eating machine

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

summary:
PokéMarch 2019 Day 17: A Pokemon you couldn't wait to evolve (Budew)!
#artofpokemarch2019
This one is pretty literal actually -...
body:
PokéMarch 2019 Day 17: A Pokemon you couldn’t wait to evolve (Budew)!

#artofpokemarch2019

This one is pretty literal actually - I really did try to be patient, but my Rosie just refused to evolve. Eventually I had to just catch myself a replacement Roselia, name her the same thing, and try and pretend she was the same Pokemon I’d been training since the start… Don’t look at me like that!

summary: Grass / Ghost - Head and a Base
question: Grass / Ghost - Head and a Base
answer:
Egelloom, the Parasite Flower Pokemon

Egelloom are an interesting pokemon, being a grass-type that does not photosynthesize! These pokemon share a symbiotic relationship with a special fungus that allows them to draw energy off of bigger trees and grass-types.

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1547: Archeops (Noble Victories)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1547: Archeops (Noble Victories)
body:
Archeops seemed to be an attempt at a new Aerodactyl, and the card did try to play that role as well. It brought back the Ability to prevent players from playing Pokemon from the hand to evolve their Pokemon, which could be pretty cool in a format with a lot of Evolved Pokemon. Archeops, however, showed up around the point where Basic Pokemon were quite dominant, which could give the card a tough time when it came to being relevant. There were a fair few decks still relying on those, however, and a reprint gave Archeops one more format to work with than most, so maybe it could find some way to make things work over the 2 and a half years it had to work with?

130 HP was fine, though it wasn’t as spectacular on a Stage 1 here as it would be normally since Archen had to be restored from a fossil which made Archeops more like a Stage 2 that lacked Rare Candy access. The Grass Weakness was rather strange for a Pokemon that shouldn’t have had it, but it could have been worse. The occasional Virizion in the HGSS-On format was annoying, and it did provide issues against Virizion EX and even the rather rare Leafeon in the NXD-On format as well. Archeops needed 2 Energy to retreat, so you probably needed some help there to make best use of this Pokemon.

Ancient Power was a really interesting Ability that meant that each player couldn’t play Pokemon from their hand to evolve their Pokemon. This was cool if you could somehow get Archeops out somewhat quickly and were facing a deck relying heavily on evolving things. The big problem was that Archeops needed to be restored and then evolved just to get to this point. This gave a bit of a window to evolve. This all was not to mention all the Pokemon EX decks that just didn’t care. It was notable, in the NXD-On format, that a nice combo could work with Pyroar. If you got a Pyroar in as the Active Pokemon and had Archeops in the back, you were safe from Basic Pokemon while the opponent couldn’t Evolve. It wasn’t consistently fast enough but it could be very effective.

Rock Slide did 60 damage for 2 Fighting and a Colorless Energy. That, even though it let you get in 10 damage to 2 of the opponent’s Benched Pokemon, really wasn’t enough.

Archeops had a very interesting concept that, for the first two formats it was allowed in, came at the wrong time. It was definitely better alongside Pyroar in the NXD-On format, but was still a bit short of tournament-worthy due to how hard it was to set up. Archeops would have been a bit better if it didn’t have to start out by restoring a fossil. The idea of the card was quite good, at least. It was a very fun option for a casual deck due to this.

blog.name: pokemon-universes
blog.title: WELCOME
blog.description:
THIS BLOG IS ABOUT POKEMON, MY FAVORITE SHIPS AND MY FAN KIDS

PLEASE BE RESPECTFUL

summary:
( I will called the ship: TropicalHealthShipping )
English Name: Althea Joy
Japanese Name: Akari 
Age: 16
Hair Color: Fuchsia...
body:
MEET MY BROCK X ALOLA NURSE JOY ( Akala ) FAN KID

Daughter of Brock and Akala Nurse Joy

( I will called the ship: TropicalHealthShipping )

Personal Data:

English Name: Althea Joy

Japanese Name: Akari

Age: 16

Hair Color: Fuchsia

Eye color: Sky Blue

History:

Birthplace: Konikoni City, Akala Island, Alola Region

Hometown: Konikoni City, Akala Island, Alola Region

Current location: Traveling

Occupation: Gym Leader Of Konikoni City ( Currently her Twin is Taking care of the Gym since Althea is Traveling to become a better Trainer ) and Pokemon Trainer

Affiliations: Konikoni Gym Of konikoni City

Alignment: Good

Preferences:

Likes: Pokemon, Romance ( Won’t admit it ), Sweets And Flowers


Dislikes: Pollution, People hurting pokémons and Annoying Guys


Fears: The Dark


Berserk buttons: people hurting pokémons and people telling her she looks like her cousins, Aunts And Mother ( She stills love her Cousins, Aunts And Mother )

Achievements:

Badges: None

Other achievements: None

Descriptions:

Personality: Serious, Intelligent, Gentle, Kind, Caring, Romantic and Helpful


Battle strategy: Defensive


Relatives:


Brock( Father )


Akala Nurse Joy ( Mother )


Altha joy ( Twin Sister)


Emma Joy ( Younger Sister )


Galena Joy ( Younger Sister )


Sirona Joy ( Younger Sister)


Aala Joy ( Younger Sister )


Lele Joy ( Younger Sister )


Brian ( Adoptive Younger Brother)


Poni nurse joy ( Aunt )

summary: Shruberig, the mossy dinosaur pokemon. Shruberig are small, shy pokemon, their green color and moss covered back helps...
caption:
Shruberig, the mossy dinosaur pokemon.

Shruberig are small, shy pokemon, their green color and moss covered back helps camouflage them from predators. This pokemon is very loyal and once a trainer has bonded with it and gained it’s trust, they have a friend for life.

Floradon, the floral dinosaur pokemon.

Once evolved, Floradon becomes very bold and outgoing, often sparing with others of it’s own species using the horn on it’s head. This pokemon gains nutrients from the plants and flowers growing on it’s back, it’s often seen followed by Combee that pollinate it’s flowers.

Another UK dinosaur inspired fakemon, this time Iguanodon! The horn on it’s head is inspired by early inaccurate reconstructions of the dinosaur that placed it’s thumb claw on it’s head.
